parts.text:
Spack

```json
{
  "application": "Spack",
  "details": {
    "package_manager": "Spack",
    "package": "trilinos@13.0.1",
    "compiler": "gcc@10.2.0",
    "variants": "+adios2 +amesos +amesos2 +anasazi +aztec ~basker +belos +boost ~chaco ~complex ~cuda ~cuda_rdc ~debug ~dtk +epetra +epetraext ~epetraextbtf ~epetraextexperimental ~epetraextgraphreorderings ~exodus +explicit_template_instantiation ~float +fortran +gtest +hdf5 ~hypre +ifpack +ifpack2 ~intrepid ~intrepid2 ~ipo ~isorropia +kokkos ~mesquite ~minitensor +ml +mpi +muelu ~mumps ~nox ~openmp ~phalanx ~piro +python ~rol ~rythmos +sacado ~scorec ~shards +shared ~shylu ~stk ~stokhos ~stratimikos ~strumpack +suite-sparse ~superlu +superlu-dist ~teko ~tempus +tpetra ~trilinoscouplings ~wrapper ~x11 ~zoltan ~zoltan2",
    "dependencies": "^adios2@2.7.1/$(spack find --format '{hash:7}' adios2@2.7.1 % ${SPACK_COMPILER} +mpi ^openmpi@4.1.3) ^boost@1.77.0/$(spack find --format '{hash:7}' boost@1.77.0 % ${SPACK_COMPILER} ~mpi) ^hdf5@1.10.7/$(spack find --format '{hash:7}' hdf5@1.10.7 % ${SPACK_COMPILER} +mpi ^openmpi@4.1.3) ^parmetis@4.0.3/$(spack find --format '{hash:7}' parmetis@4.0.3 % ${SPACK_COMPILER} ^openmpi@4.1.3) ^superlu-dist@7.1.1/$(spack find --format '{hash:7}' superlu-dist@7.1.1 % ${SPACK_COMPILER} ~int64 ^openmpi@4.1.3)",
    "resource_requirements": {
      "scheduler": "Slurm",
      "nodes": 1,
      "tasks_per_node": 1,
      "cpus_per_task": 16,
      "memory": "32G",
      "time": "01:00:00",
      "scratch_dir": "/scratch/${USER}/job_${SLURM_JOB_ID}"
    }
  }
}
```

This script is running Spack, a package manager for scientific software. It uses Slurm as a scheduler, and is requesting a single node with a single task, 16 cpus per task, 32 GB of memory, and a runtime of 1 hour. The script specifies that the scratch directory should be located at `/scratch/${USER}/job_${SLURM_JOB_ID}`. The script then proceeds to use Spack to concretize and install the Trilinos package, along with a number of dependent packages. 

The script also contains various environment variables that define the system name, Spack version, compiler, package, variants, and dependencies. These variables are used to configure Spack and to ensure that the correct packages are installed with the desired options.
